text: i’ve worked a bit more on the pattern prototype with Chris today and gotten around to finessing all the new variables he’s given me… feel free to come play with it on the Compass iphone at my desk
oohh fun. i’ve got a meeting but will check it out after
<!channel> make sure to see trent’s note and check out the home screen visualization
also don’t want to forget Melissa’s note from yesterday evening. i’m wondering Melissa if we’re proposing to change the current location for launch, or if that’s a post launch consideration
if we land on a solution that we like, i would like to propose it for launch, since we havent started building those screens yet
Yes please, will come and play at Trent’s desk. And yes please to all designers. Take a look at the + button/location

Ok makes sense, would like to hear from felix and matt on that front in terms of how they feel about that placement, as i know a lot of explorations were tried in visual design pass. If we all agree, we can suggest for launch but let’s be smart about how we do so we don’t stir the israel monster

just my two cents on button placement — while I think all are viable options, I skew away from anything that covers the pattern. There’s a cleanliness to that, especially once we start thinking of drawer interactions over pattern, that I think is helpful to maintain.
Specifically thinking of v F-I for the overlap

yeah, i think there are pros and cons to that placement… i think it might place too much prominence on that action which is not a primary action, but i do like how it starts to unify the header with the pattern, because you are in fact adding to both…
what is v F-I?
oh the versions F - I in the explorations you posted yesterday
all of them with the overlapping +, part in header, part over pattern
ahh gotcha
Agree with the prominence too for those
esp. in colored versions
would love to see other explorations, since I also have not been here when you guys explored
several people are typing
yeah i’d be happy to look at older explorations too, i never saw those
i dont mind the first two. I wish we didn’t have to reduce the BOS, or move it up, but i guess you’d have to

So with that in mind, my brain moves to that other non-overlapping placement. Personally dont’ feel too strongly one way or another right now, though would just want to make sure the visual language is consistent
or re-spec, or re-share with dev…

so things like the subtle shadow button version (D) - not sure how it plays with other aspects of the app. And admittedly, I’m not as in tune with every piece of the puzzle we’re playing with in terms of motifs.
So if we have lots of shadow things, i could be steered on that for sure
totally. like i said this was a pretty quick exploration and i’d love to see what others come up with
anyway - i think they’re all pretty viable.
but my head goes toward non-overlap for a few reasons
luckily the BOS is a pretty strong mark and holds up to slight shrinking, esp on screen
esp knowing that it’s not meant to be a primary action
the more i think about it the more i agree. couldn’t not try it tho :slightly_smiling_face:
totally
i should also caveat — I’m losing track of what exactly we’re trying to solve in these moves.
So i think the new placement options clean a few things up, but i know that lots of motion work has happened for similar area of app.
If any of these options solve something, i’m all in
yeah this is related to the motion discussions
totally
anyway - those are opinions that were not asked for! My two cents in all cases. :wink:
i’m going to be that guy again (i know, i sound like israel), but even changing the size of the logo is making my alarm go off. we’ll have to respec and tell dev to change it
and being the main account person here, i’m concerned this won’t go over well
oh i’m concerned on that front as well.
for what its worth i dont believe theyve started on the homescreen yet, but my knowledge might be out of date
i don’t think that’s really the issue though
at this point, any change is change
the logo has already been built/placed on the profile screen
sadly
agree with ewald
right, makes sense
if we’ve a compelling thing we’re chasing for launch, i’m fine exploring.
right. that’s why i didn’t want to move the BOS
another one of Scott’s requirements was that it didn’t jump from tab to tab
but it really is tricky time in terms of any change at this point — on an account side of things
as we all know. lots of stuff to consider. which makes it difficult.

why don’t we do this: Try and fid a plus icon treatment that can live on the far right. maybe it’s a bit smaller. maybe lighter. but use the constraints that we’re stuck with. If it doesn’t work, then we’ll stick with what we got until 1.1

not that we can’t push for it. I just don’t know what we’re chasing in some of these things (personally). Cleaning up a small interaction may or may not rise above the bar of measure for whatever mechanics are required for change

yeah, that makes a lot of sense. <@U026103R3> i’d be interested to hear from adrian/kat how much of an effort it would be to shift it on profile. this might be one of those situations where (if we feel it makes sense) we can just do it and israel will never know.
I’d like us to avoid that sort of thing at this point if i’m being honest
ironically ‘just do it'

totally hear you that there are some cases where we just change it and nobody knows, but sadly at this point even if we bother the developers to ask how much effort it is to change something we get dinged :confused:
ok
i think matt’s suggestion is a solid one
can we try to find a placement that works with our current constraints? and if no, plan on a maybe even larger change for post launch?
yea i think that’s fine
let’s just get rid of the add button altogether and use a “shake phone to add” gesture
ship it
“go on a 20 min run to add a 20 min run"
_phone must be continuously shaken for full exercise duration_
this game might actually get me to exercise...
it’s essentially a Smart Shake Weight®
(i had one of those)
lol
ok, sounds like a first "just explore with ‘add +' without BOS change as a start” everybody on board? hot topic :slightly_smiling_face:
but i like the smart shake too

So consider this a proof of concept rather than a final idea proposal, but this is how the “garage door” idea is coming along. It is in no way developer friendly the way it’s been made and I definitely have to find a slightly different angle to work this if we want to move forward, but this is the core idea of what we’ve discussed, jerry-rigged into existence.

<https://www.dropbox.com/s/3pv8iwzpc4y2zx1/160831_ActivityBar_New_GarageDoor_01.mov?dl=0>

<@U026E0ZNR|trent> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/trent/F273CJCVB/sticks_max_fill_options.zip|Sticks Max Fill Options.zip> and commented: More to make you all do. Here are screen shots of the pattern with different max states. Set at 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, and 5000... 3 versions of each to get an idea of multiple end states for the same settings. 

Everyone tell me what feels like a good end state. And if you want to watch what it looks like animating to get there I can share a custom build with whatever value you want.

initial_comment.comment:
More to make you all do. Here are screen shots of the pattern with different max states. Set at 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, and 5000... 3 versions of each to get an idea of multiple end states for the same settings. 

Everyone tell me what feels like a good end state. And if you want to watch what it looks like animating to get there I can share a custom build with whatever value you want.

text: I still like the 5000, nothing below 4000 in my option.
personally digging 4000 and 5000 options, and the garage roll up motion study is coming along nicely :ok_hand:

Hey I’ve got a question, not sure if it’s UX or Dev… or both… but with this new activity animation we’re working through, will this be exclusively system driven (read: canned animation) or will the user be able to interact with it, tapping on one of the new line items during that peek preview, or even opening the whole drawer before it autoscrolls back upward?
not wanting to be a copy cat :tiger: i also like 4000 and 5000. It’ll also be more rewarding to see more strokes being added.

also really like garage door development :slightly_smiling_face: 
wonder if there is a bit more time to show strokes being added and minutes rising, since adding icons is now longer (time wise)

i can definitely extend the amount of time strokes animate, i’m mostly ignoring that in these AE renders though since I’m tweaking burst timing in the OpenGL prototype. 

one thing i just talked through with Melissa is the idea that this “garage door” idea, the way it’s currently done, is not very scalable. meaning it looks great as a rendered video but if we add or subtract more icons/list items, it’s actually a whole new (though visually similar) set of animation parameters. AKA i’m cheating in a way with how i’ve made this and it also may fall apart if a user is able to interact with the list items before the animation is finished. 

currently thinking through a way to make this a bit more considered
